TopicTitle: What did you name your first rocket?

Articles.Content:
test

I even forgot the capital!
Space!!!!!
I called my first rocket in carreer mode "CASIO I" which stands for "Cheap And Safe Into Orbit I" I was very optimistic when I first launched it, but it instantly fell apart on the launchpad...
I call all my rockets Invasion + something. Because my program is the beginning of the Kerbal galaxy invasion.

Untitled Space Craft

If this is not your answer you were not eager enough to launch your first rocket!
Datum 1. IDK why.

Firecracker 1. It was a small liquid fueled rocket after Jeb rejected a perfectly good RT-10 on the basis that he was not 'going to fly a glorified firecracker'. So the engineers in the VAB decided to have a little joke.
i normaly name mine after greek gods and thier familly members, some had horses with epic names too. just google =)

I call all my rockets Invasion + something. Because my program is the beginning of the Kerbal galaxy invasion.

Someone should do an Invader Zim meets Jebediah Kerman drawing.
Stage 1: The Beginnings. Such a humble start to my interplanetary expenditure...

Manned rocket Apology 1

First probe, Sputter 1
My first / line happens to be, "Kerbal Go Boom"

Jeb's First Rocket.

A capsule. Chute on top, SRB on the bottom, antennae on the sides. It went up, it came down again.
I named my first manned rocket Jebini and my first probe Kerby.
Crash and Burn v1.0
"Starting out". No, I'm serious. I ran out of creative names. I should have named it something else.
Basic Rocket 1 Never got to orbit either Basic Rocket 4 or 5 got the orbit

my first craft was a bunch on parts stuck together in some kind of a ledgible order. it was called awesome.

i gave up on it after some launches, then found that all it needed was some struts and flying skills, and a few other tweaks. afterwards, the rocket had a 100% sucsess rate (only for mechanical failures) and took me to the mun over 20 times.

but this was in the demo.
Way back in the demo I evolved the "MonkeyLauncher" line of rockets

This was a long time ago in the 13.3 demo

MK.1 ish something.......

I can't remember after getting KSP three years ago

my first craft was a bunch on parts stuck together in some kind of a ledgible order. it was called awesome.

i gave up on it after some launches, then found that all it needed was some struts and flying skills, and a few other tweaks. afterwards, the rocket had a 100% sucsess rate (only for mechanical failures) and took me to the mun over 20 times.

but this was in the demo.

I bet none of your Kerbals ever stayed dead long

but since it's already risen from the dead - mine was called the BoomPod, because it was just a pod with as many flea boosters strapped onto it as I could fit (oh and some fins and some chutes with the leftover parts after max weight was reaxhed)
Untitled Space Craft

Back in the demo, my first rocket was named Proteus I, because it sounded cool at the time.

By the time of my current savegame, I have more fully embraced the Kerbal lore, and so:

- My first probe-carrying rocket was named Kerbstar 1

- My first crewed rocket (with Jeb inside) was named Kerbal 1

Agorophile.

"Lover of wide open spaces" seemed an appropriate name for a vehicle bound for space.
I think it was Big Lizard, cause the first Lizard was too small to get onto orbit. My first orbital rocket in RO was Ferret 4.
